summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeKnours. 2-in-1 Oil-to-Foam Non-Stripping Facial Cleanser is an oil to foam cleanser that doubles down to clean skin more effectively. The hybrid cleanser starts off as a plant based blend of oils to dissolve dirt and makeup, then transforms into a foam when water is added for an easy double cleanse.
details: DetailsBenefitsEasy double cleanseOil to foam formula gently dissolves and rinses away makeup, dirt, and impuritiesLeaves skin clean and refreshed without drynessFormula is non-toxic, fragrance-free, and EWG-verifiedKey IngredientsSweet Orange Peel Oil to help clarify the skinChamomile Oil to provide calming benefitsOlive Oil to nourish the skinItem 2626221How To UseApply desired amount to dry skin and gently massage to remove makeup. Wet hands amply and massage into a rich lather. Rinse thoroughly with water and pat dry.Precautions: For external use only. Do not swallow. Keep out of reach of children. Avoid contact with eyes.IngredientsWater, Coco-Betaine, Decyl Glucoside, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil, Glycerin, Sodium Chloride, Sodium Hydroxide, Citric Acid, Caprylyl Glociol, 1,2-Hexanediol, Origanum Majorana Leaf Oil, Lavendula Angusrifolia (Lavender) Oil, Zanthoxylum Piperitum Fruit Extract, Usnea Barbara (Lichen) Extract, Pulsatilla Korean Extract, Betain, Honey Extract, Sodium Phytate, Anthemis Nobilis Flower Oil, Pelagonium Graveolens Leaf Oil, Simmondsia Chinesis (Jojoba) Seed Oil, Black Strap Powder, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Orange) Peel Oil, Cannabis Sative Seed Oil, Prunus Armeniaca (Apricot) Kernel Oil, Brassica Oleracea Italica (Broccoli) Seed Oil, Alcohol, Limonene, Linalool.
how_to_use: Apply desired amount to dry skin and gently massage to remove makeup. Wet hands amply and massage into a rich lather. Rinse thoroughly with water and pat dry.Precautions: For external use only. Do not swallow. Keep out of reach of children. Avoid contact with eyes.

reviews.headline: Good, basic cleanser. Great for travel!
reviews.comments:
I dont find that its really an "oil to foam" but more like a gel. It does break down makeup and as a sahm who is exhausted at night, i love that i can skip that extra step and just use this. My face can feel tight and dry after using but i dont mind because i use hydrating things after. It doesnt burn my eyes and they are super sensitive. It also has seem to help clear a small brealput i had when i bought it. 

I do have one complaintâ€¦. The smell. Its bery earthy and strong. It reminds me of tea tree oil. Its gojng to take slme getting used to And i do have a cooling feeling when i use it. 

Im exploring korean skincare so i may try something else but i wpuld recommend trying this!

reviews.headline: Amazing!
reviews.comments: This makes my face feel like I have a mask on after I use it! Super tight and fresh feeling!! Would definitely buy again.

reviews.headline: Great product for the price
reviews.comments: Makes my skin feel squeaky clean but not tight feeling. The scent is pretty light and I like how affordable it is. Great for everyday use on sensitive skin.

reviews.headline: Wanted to love it
reviews.comments: I was excited for the 2 in 1 but it stings my eyes every time I use it and I don't love the texture (not offensive just a by product of the 2 in 1)

reviews.headline: Great for sensitive skin
reviews.comments: Impressed with this cleanser as it makes my skin feel super clean and removes makeup without stripping my skin. Just got my second bottle!

reviews.headline: A Great Cleanser for Postpartum Skin
reviews.comments:
Definitely not an oil but still a great cleanser none the less. Takes off makeup well. Not stripping. Smells great.

Early 30's with very sensitive postpartum skin and it doesn't irritate at all. Can't wait to try other products from this brand.

reviews.headline: SO close to being perfect
reviews.comments:
Overall a REALLY good product but one specific con defeats the purpose IMO.

Pros: 
Removed 99% of my makeup with ease *
Doesnt leave a film on my skin 

Cons:
Not a fan of the citrus smell
Slightly drying
* Took a generous amount of effort to remove my mascara and ultimately burned TF out of my eyes. (I assume the purpose of this product is to replace the double cleanse system but whats the point if I'll have to use another cleanser around my eyes to avoid burning them???)

reviews.headline: A holy grail product
reviews.comments: I have intensely sensitive skin that reacts to things so easily, including a lot of oil cleansers-- this helped heal my skin barrier and is soothing, effective, and a little goes a long way.  Doesn't dry you out, but definitely gets you thoroughly cleansed!

reviews.headline: Good facial cleanser
reviews.comments: I love the smell. Its not too drying. Definitely a good facial cleanser.

reviews.headline: My first oil!!!
reviews.comments: Leaves my skin GLOWING!!! I use this before i use my usual face wash and i must say it leaves my skin looking like GLASS!!! I will def be buying more from this brand. It doesnt dry out my skin nor leaves it greasy at all

reviews.headline: Great Face Wash
reviews.comments: I'm 42 with super sensitive skin and I tried this cleanser on a whim. It's a game changer. My skin hasn't been breaking out and feels so soft after using it. Highly recommend this product.

reviews.headline: Returned
reviews.comments: Didn't remove eye makeup. Have tried multiple oils and this will be returned. Worked ok for a face wash, left my skin feeling clean after washing in the morning ( no makeup). Mid 30's combo skin. Will stick with DHC deep cleansing oil- that's the true original oil wash!

reviews.headline: Not an oil, but a decent cleanser
reviews.comments:
I was looking for a replacement for L'Occitane's Oil-to-Milk Cleanser, since after their most recent reformulation I found it too expensive and the new scent unpleasant. I was looking with a similar texture (suitable for oil cleansing, but emulsifying for easy rinsing) and easy makeup removal with a lower price point, and hopefully, a better scent.
While the Knours cleanser does remove my waterproof makeup well, I can't use it oil cleasing as it is not oily. I'm not sure why this is marketed as an oil, it is thick like a liquid soap and coats dry skin like a traditional foaming cleanser. Smell is okay, faintly plant-like, but not as herbaceous and unpleasant as the cleanser I intended to replace. I will continue to search for my perfect emulsifying oil cleanser, but I do appreciate its non-stripping, makeup-removing abilities.

reviews.headline: Thorough makeup remover
reviews.comments: I tried this out recently to remove a full face of makeup and it worked wonderfully. It broke down my makeup quickly and thoroughly. My skin felt soft and clean afterwards. Because I'm acne prone, I still cleanse with a water based cleanser after. Love this!

reviews.headline: Very Hydrating - Great for ALL skin types
reviews.comments:
First - the pump puts out WAY TOO MUCH product so I push the pump only 1/3 - 1/2 way down or it is a waste.

This is a sudsy cleaner with no fragrance. It leaves my combo skin so fresh I had a hard time realizing it was completely washed off at first. ZERO tightness. My skin is so clean and hydrated - I bought this because I am using the serum (which I also reviewed) that I love so much.  I dampen my face and apply a little to each zone (forehead, cheeks, nose, chin) and use my Clarisonic (yep, mine still works!)  I will be rebuying.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: New favorite face wash for my dry skinn

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: I've used face washes in the past such as cetaphil and they never worked so I just used water. decided to try this out and wow my skin has never felt better. I pair it with drunk elephant moisturizer

reviews.headline: Very good
reviews.comments: Gentle and doesn't destroy my skin barrier and maintain my skin barrier. It pulls some some of my "blackhead" ( forgot what it was called ) gently. Acne prone and combination skin.

faceoff_positive.comments: ok I never write reviews. Ever. I'm face this is my first time ever writing a review before but I am soooo blown away by this cleanser that I had to. I have the most annoying hormonal acne and everything makes my skin worse. EVERYTHING. if there is a cleanser out there I have tied it. Along with hormonal acne I also have dry sensitive skin that prone to clogged pores. I decided to give this cleanser a chance because why not I try them all anyways. But after using this for 2 days I can honestly say that I will never use anything else. It's the perfect consistency. Doesn't dry out the skin, removes every ounce of makeup possible. You skin is left feeling clean and not stripped at all. IT'S MY HOLY GRAIL now which is crazy for me to say because I have never had a holy grail cleanser I'm my entire life. This is chefs kiss! I need to try everything else in this product line now.
faceoff_positive.headline: the.best.

faceoff_negative.comments:
I was looking for a replacement for L'Occitane's Oil-to-Milk Cleanser, since after their most recent reformulation I found it too expensive and the new scent unpleasant. I was looking with a similar texture (suitable for oil cleansing, but emulsifying for easy rinsing) and easy makeup removal with a lower price point, and hopefully, a better scent.
While the Knours cleanser does remove my waterproof makeup well, I can't use it oil cleasing as it is not oily. I'm not sure why this is marketed as an oil, it is thick like a liquid soap and coats dry skin like a traditional foaming cleanser. Smell is okay, faintly plant-like, but not as herbaceous and unpleasant as the cleanser I intended to replace. I will continue to search for my perfect emulsifying oil cleanser, but I do appreciate its non-stripping, makeup-removing abilities.
faceoff_negative.headline: Not an oil, but a decent cleanser
